Welcome to the seamonsters library documentation!¶

This is Team 2605’s Python library for robot code. It builds on wpilib and adds useful utilities for working with input, motors, drivetrains, and Commands, as well as for simulation without a robot and for quick and simple tests.

Terminology¶

In the documentation you will see the terms “position mode”, “incremental position mode”, and “jeff mode” used interchangeably. “Voltage mode” is used to refer either to Voltage or PercentVbus mode on CANTalons. Also, some classes use “velocity” in method/variable names while others use “speed.”

Index:¶

seamonsters.AccelerationFilterDrive(interface) Wraps another drive interface, and provides acceleration filtering.
seamonsters.AngledWheel(motor, x, y, angle, ...) An AngledWheel is a wheel oriented in a fixed direction, which it can’t change on its own.
seamonsters.DashboardCommandReader() Allows reading data entered in the Command box on the dashboard.
seamonsters.DriveInterface A generic, abstract interface for driving a robot.
seamonsters.DynamicAxis([exponent, ...]) Makes values from a joystick axis go higher if you push them faster.
seamonsters.DynamicPIDDrive(interface, ...) Wraps another drive interface.
seamonsters.FieldOrientedDrive(interface, ahrs) Wraps another drive interface, and provides field orientation.
seamonsters.Gamepad(port) An extended Joystick specifically designed for Logitech gamepads.
seamonsters.GeneratorBot() A robot which runs generators throughout the cycles of autonomous, teleop, and test mode.
seamonsters.IterativeRobotInstance(robotType) Allows an “instance” of an IterativeRobot to be created without connecting to HAL or LiveWindow.
seamonsters.LogState(name[, logFrequency]) Represents a value important to the user that is constantly changing.
seamonsters.MecanumWheel(motor, x, y, angle, ...) An angled Mecanum wheel.
seamonsters.MultiDrive(interface) Wraps another DriveInterface, and allows drive() to be called multiple times in a loop.
seamonsters.SuperHolonomicDrive()
seamonsters.SwerveWheel(angledWheel, ...[, ...]) A wheel which can rotate.
seamonsters.TestDriveInterface A DriveInterface which does nothing but log the magnitude/direction/turn values it receives.
seamonsters.TestWheel(name, x, y) Logs parameters for drive(), for testing.
seamonsters.Wheel(x, y) Interface for wheels.
seamonsters.deadZone(value[, deadZone, maxValue]) Add a dead-zone to the number.
seamonsters.ensureTrue(iterable, requiredCount) Wait until the iterable yields True for a certain number of consecutive iterations before finishing.
seamonsters.forever() Iterate forever.
seamonsters.getSwitch(name, defaultValue) Get whether a switch on the dashboard is enabled.
seamonsters.parallel(\*iterables) Run a group of iterables in parallel.
seamonsters.readPoints(filePath, ...) Given an SVG with a path created in GIMP, read all the points in the path and return a list of points.
seamonsters.returnValue(iterable, value) Run an iterable but change the return value.
seamonsters.sendLogStates() Send all LogStates that have been updated to the dashboard
seamonsters.sequence(\*iterables) Run a set of iterables sequentially
seamonsters.setActiveCameraURL(url) Set the URL of the camera stream to display in the dashboard
seamonsters.talonModeToString(mode) Get a readable name from a ctre.ControlMode constant
seamonsters.timeLimit(iterable, time) Run the iterable until it finishes or the given time limit has passed.
seamonsters.untilButtonPressed(joystick, button) A generator which runs until the joystick button is pressed, then exits.
seamonsters.untilTrue(iterable) Run the iterable until it yields True, then stop.
seamonsters.wait(time) Wait for a certain number of iterations.
seamonsters.watch(\*iterables) Run a group of iterables in parallel.
seamonsters.whileButtonPressed(joystick, button) A generator which runs while the joystick button is pressed, then exits.
